alert.note: Alert for Boone; Newton; Searcy (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 3:18PM CDT until June 08 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Boone County in north central Arkansas... Northeastern Newton County in north central Arkansas... Northwestern Searcy County in north central Arkansas... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 318 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Harrison, Western Grove, Valley Springs, Dugger, Olvey, Crawford, Point Peter, Eula, Duff, Capps, Marsena, Bellefonte, Everton, St. Joe, Pindall, Batavia, Gilbert, Bear Creek Springs, Yardelle and Hasty. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
